cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi (340 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the northwest Caribbean, expected to turn north across the south-central Gulf on Tuesday and accelerate north-northeast toward the Louisiana-Mississippi coast by late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the mouth of the Mississippi River/Buras-New Orleans area)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Mississippi–Alabama border, spreading inland into Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (port is well inland on the Mississippi River)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible Wednesday evening into early Thursday; 28 % chance of sustained ≥34 kt, 9 % chance ≥50 kt at Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port itself, minor river level rise possible but below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2-4 inches with isolated 6 inches possible Wednesday night–Thursday; risk of localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river current increase and floating debris could hinder navigation immediately after heavy rainfall.
